chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: A Psalm and Song at the dedication of the house of David.
items.plainText: A Psalm and Song at the dedication of the house of David.

items.text: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
items.plainText: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

items.text: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
items.plainText: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

items.text: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
items.plainText: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

items.text: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
items.plainText: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

items.text: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
items.plainText: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

items.text: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
items.plainText: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

items.text: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
items.plainText: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.

items.text: I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.
items.plainText: I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.

items.text: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
items.plainText: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

items.text: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
items.plainText: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.

items.text: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
items.plainText: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

items.text: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
items.plainText: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
